page.title: 01Kennethmont:An Introduction
page.content: About 8 miles from Huntly on the B.9002 and on the Inverness/Aberdeen railway line lies the small rural village of Kennethmont (popn 470 approx).The village streches along the main road for about a mile,although population is most concentrated at two centres,"Kirkhill"at the western end, and around Ardmore Distillery at the eastern end.Halfway between these two population centres lie the playing fields,the Rannes Hall,the school and the church. The National Trust For Scotland owns considerable property to the north of Kennethmont,including Leith Hall built in 1649. In this predominantly agricultural area most jobs are associated with farming. Other employment is provided by a shop ,a Post Office,a garage,the school,the pub,a coal merchant's business and by the local whisky distillery .
